intro: Irlbachia cardonae, commonly known as the desert cactus of the Canary Islands, is a member of the Cactaceae family. It is a small, spineless cactus that typically grows in rocky, arid environments. The plant features a globular stem with a thick, waxy cuticle to reduce water loss. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, appearing in the spring. Irlbachia cardonae is well adapted to extreme desert conditions, showcasing remarkable resilience to drought and high temperatures.
